newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank shares sharply lower in mid-morning trade.
newsitem.headline: Softbank shares sharply lower in mid-morning trade.

text.p: Shares in Softbank Corp were sharply lower in mid-morning Wednesday trade, dragged down by the company's decision on Tuesday to issue new stock and convertible bonds, brokers said.
As of 0130 GMT, the shares were at 8,500 yen, after finishing at 9,020 in over-the-counter trading on Tuesday.
On Tuesday, Softbank said it planned to issue 4.7 million new shares as well as 10 billion yen worth of convertible bonds with a maturity date set for March 31, 2000.
The firm said it would raise 53.7 billion yen through the bonds and new share issues.
The shares were weak in Tuesday trade in the over-the-counter market, hitting a new low for the year due to fears of a glut.
